program_title: Off-Farm Labor Housing Loans and Grants
program_description_purpose: provides low interest loans and grants to eligible borrowers to develop or rehabilitate affordable rental housing for very-low, low- or moderate-income domestic, migrant, and seasonal farm laborers.
program_description_borrower_requirement: Borrowers must not otherwise be able to get commercial credit.
program_features_funding_description: Announced annually through a Notice of Solicitation of Applications (NOSA) placed in the Federal Register.
program_features_grant_amount_descriptio: Grants are available only to nonprofit entities and can fund up to 90 percent of the project cost.
program_features_loan_amount_description: The maximum loan amount is indicated in the Federal Register NOSA.
program_features_rental_assistance_descr: Rental Assistance (RA) and Operating Assistance (OA) information appears in the annual NOSA.
who_can_apply_type_6: Limited partnerships with a nonprofit general partner. Must meet 7 CFR 3560.55(d) requirements
eligible_tenants_includes_2: individuals who earn a substantial portion of their income from farm labor and their families
eligible_tenants_includes_3: retired farm laborers and their families
eligible_tenants_includes_4: disabled farm laborers and their families
eligible_tenants_occupant_requirement_3: those legally admitted to this country and authorized to perform work in agriculture
eligible_tenants_income_eligibility_desc: based on household size, and ranges from very-low to moderate-income.
governing_program_2_name: Title V of the Housing Act of 1949
for_more_information_instructions: scroll to the bottom of the page to find your processing and review branch, based on the state in which your project is located.
note_equal_opportunity_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
